body_html:
@peterjc123 I set core.autocrlf to false manually on Windows, because it is problematic setting for me. (I sometimes copies from/to Unix-like systems, and so on)
Doing git --local core.autocrlf true in local repository also fixes this problem, but I think adding .gitattributes file (like below) could be a appropriate fix. (bat's EOL is always set CRLF whatever user settings is)

*.bat  text eol=crlf

How about?
body_text:
@peterjc123  I set core.autocrlf to false manually on Windows, because it is problematic setting for me. (I sometimes copies from/to Unix-like systems, and so on)
Doing git --local core.autocrlf true in local repository also fixes this problem, but I think adding .gitattributes file (like below) could be a appropriate fix. (bat's EOL is always set CRLF whatever user settings is)
*.bat  text eol=crlf

How about?
body:
@peterjc123  I set `core.autocrlf` to `false` manually on Windows, because it is problematic setting for me. (I sometimes copies from/to Unix-like systems, and so on)
Doing `git --local core.autocrlf true` in local repository also fixes this problem, but I think adding `.gitattributes` file (like below) could be a appropriate fix. (bat's EOL is always set CRLF whatever user settings is)
~~~
*.bat  text eol=crlf
~~~
How about?
